page.title: 18Past Customs - Tamar Valley
page.content: In the old days the community spirit was very strong as most villagers were interrelated. Today's ease of transport has altered this completely.On Saturday nights the main street of Gunnislake was busy with people talking and being entertained by the Salvation Army or local brass band. This area always used to be a musical area. On Sunday evening people from all the villages in our area went "Up Turnpike". This was the main road from the station to the end of St Ann's Chapel. Many local romances started here. People were prepered to sit up all night with the sick and dying and help out in times of need. In the 20's and 30's the poverty for some families was shocking especially one-parent families.
